days.title: HEAL Partnership
days.description: Mark Miller Subaru partners with renewable energy pioneer, HEAL, to support their mission of protecting public health by promoting the use of renewable and sustainable energy, and working to adopt stricter vehicle standards for all new cars.
days.shortdesc: Mark Miller Subaru partners with Utah's renewable energy pioneer, HEAL.

days.title: Subaru Loves the Earth Launched
days.description: As a reflection of our long-standing commitment to doing good out in the world, Subaru Loves the Earth initiative launches and invites Subaru retailers do their part by adopting environmentally friendly facilities and policies in their local communities, making a strong effort to get out into the community and roll up their sleeves to help promote environmental responsibility any way they can.
days.shortdesc: As a reflection of our long-standing commitment to doing good out in the world, Subaru Loves the Earth initiative launches.

days.title: Environmental expert: Dr. David Craig
days.description: Straub Environmental Center and Capitol Subaru hosts environmental expert – Dr. David Craig – to share his unique insight and expertise on how to protect and preserve Oregon's white oak, a native tree that is crucial to the Willamette Valley and the countless wildlife species it supports.
days.shortdesc: Straub Environmental Center and Capitol Subaru hosts environmental expert – Dr. David Craig –  to share his unique insight and expertise on how to protect and preserve Oregon's white oak, a native tree that is crucial to the Willamette Valley and the countless wildlife species it supports.

days.title: Plant With Purpose Partnership to Help Haiti
days.description:
Subaru of Wichita partners with Plant With Purpose to plant 300 trees in Haiti to help with reforestation efforts in the aftermath of the 2010 earthquake. Plant With Purpose is a nonprofit organization, which reverses deforestation and poverty around the world by transforming the lives of the rural poor. Their life-changing projects include soil conservation, community-based microfinance, reforestation efforts, and veterinary care, all of which are designed to help farmers in third-world countries care for their land, provide for their families, and build a better future for their children. 

 

To learn more about how you can help visit Plant with Purpose.
days.shortdesc: Subaru of Wichita partners with Plant With Purpose to help reforest parts of Haiti impacted by the 2010 earthquake.

days.title: Subaru loves the Earth e-waste initiative launched
days.description: Subaru of America, as part of its Subaru Loves the Earth initiative, invites entire network of retailers to work with community leaders and members to gather unwanted e-waste to be recycled or re-used.
days.shortdesc: Subaru of America, as part of its Subaru Loves the Earth initiative, invites entire network of retailers to work with community leaders and members to gather unwanted e-waste to be recycled or re-used.

days.title: American Forests Releafing Project
days.description:
Nate Wade Subaru partners with American Forests for their ReLeafing project in the Dixie National Forest.

The 2012 Shingle Fire in the Cedar City District of Dixie National Forest burned approximately 8,000 acres that has negatively impacted soil conditions. American Forests commits to planting 50,000 Ponderosa Pine Trees across 500 acres, with Nate Wade Subaru donating up to 3,000 trees.
days.shortdesc: Nate Wade Subaru partners with American Forests for their ReLeafing project in the Dixie National Forest.

days.title: Five Tons of Electronic Waste Avoids the Landfill
days.description: In an effort to support the local community and work to make a positive impact on the environment, Mike Shaw Subaru in Denver participates in the first annual Subaru Loves the Earth E-Waste Recycling Event, where local citizens could bring electronic products that are non working or obsolete to be safely recycled or disposed of. Throughout the month of April, team members' efforts ended up collecting over five tons of electronic waste during the one-month collection period, waste that would have most likely ended up at the landfill.
days.shortdesc: Denver's Mike Shaw Subaru keeps over five tons of electronic waste from ending up in the landfill.

days.title: Episode 1: The Zero-Landfill Summit
days.description: Subaru invites representatives from the National Park Service, the National Parks Conservation Association, park concessionaires, recycling experts and the media to visit the zero-landfill plant in Indiana to begin forming the initial plan to help the parks become zero landfill.
days.shortdesc: Subaru assembles the team that will begin to form the plan to make the National Parks zero landfill.

days.title: Who We Are Is What We Leave Behind: Documentary Trailer
days.description: The trailer for Who We Are Is What We Leave Behind, a documentary series following the progress of the Subaru National Park Zero-Landfill Initiative debuts.
days.shortdesc: The trailer for Who We Are Is What We Leave Behind, a documentary following the progress of the Subaru National Park Zero-Landfill Initiative debuts.

days.title: Sustainable Landscape Award
days.description: Fayetteville's Adventure Subaru is awarded the 2014 UFAB Sustainable Landscape Competition which recognizes companies for their commitment to sustaining landscapes. Designed by Melissa Evans, RLA, sustainable landscape features at Adventure Subaru include: drought tolerant plants; pine straw planting beds without need for conventional weed barrier; street trees; efficient irrigation design; and use of grass pave in their overflow car storage area. Several energy-saving design elements were used in the main building as well. Although implementation of some of the sustainable features was not required by the City, Adventure Subaru's sustainable landscape and facility pays off economically, socially, and ecologically; sets a positive example for commercial development; and most importantly, represents Adventure Subaru's overall, positive commitment to the community.
days.shortdesc: Fayetteville's Adventure Subaru is awarded the 2014 UFAB Sustainable Landscape Competition which recognizes companies for their commitment to sustaining landscapes.

days.title: Who We Are Is What We Leave Behind: Styrofoam
days.description: Even the seemingly smallest idea can have enormous impact, on both the environment and the bottom line. Watch and see how one suggestion from a Subaru employee resulted in countless natural resources saved and an incredible financial windfall for Subaru.
days.shortdesc: Even the seemingly smallest idea can have enormous impact, on both the environment and the bottom line.

days.title: Subaru donates Outbacks to marquee National Parks
days.description: As part of their longstanding relationship with America's National Park Service, Subaru donates Outback SUVs to Yosemite, Denali, Grand Teton and the Grand Canyon National Parks, these four donated vehicles will help facilitate the operational needs at each of the selected national parks by supporting educational and resource management projects, traffic management, travel to gateway communities, and more.
days.shortdesc: Subaru gifts Outbacks to Yosemite, Denali, Grand Teton and the Grand Canyon National Parks.

days.title: Episode 2: Yosemite
days.description: Subaru experts visit Yosemite, the first of its Zero-Landfill Initiative pilot parks, to evaluate where it's 2200 tons of annual trash comes from and how to best address the problem.
days.shortdesc: Subaru experts visit Yosemite, the first of its Zero-Landfill Initiative pilot parks, to evaluate where it's 2200 tons of annual trash comes from and how to best address the problem.

days.title: Who We Are Is What We Leave Behind: Convenience
days.description: Through the lens of Yosemite, Subaru examines how our love of convenience is having a detrimental effect on our precious national parks.
days.shortdesc: Through the lens of Yosemite, Subaru examines how our love of convenience is having a detrimental effect on our precious national parks.

days.title: Get Involved. How You Can Help Parks Reach Zero Landfill.
days.description:
Each year, visitors to the National Parks contribute over 100 million pounds of garbage to landfills. Visit the links below to see the ways you can help them reach zero landfill when you visit each park, or click Get Involved to receive email updates about our ongoing effort.

 

What To Do Before You Leave Home

When on a Day Trip

When Camping

When Staying in a Park Hotel
days.shortdesc: Each year visitors to the national parks contribute over 100 million pounds of garbage to landfills. But there's good news: if we work together and each do our part we believe we can reduce that number to zero. See all the ways you can help these incredible places we all own become zero landfill.
